channel.title: NASA in Silicon Valley
channel.description: An in-depth look at the various researchers, scientists, engineers, and all around cool people who work at NASA to push the boundaries of innovation.
channel.itunes:subtitle: NASA in Silicon Valley audio podcast episodes
channel.itunes:summary: An in-depth look at the various researchers, scientists, engineers, and all around cool people who work at NASA to push the boundaries of innovation.
channel.itunes:keywords: NASA in Silicon Valley, podcast, nasa podcast, nasa ames, ames, nasa silicon valley
channel.itunes:author: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live – Air Taxis and the Future of Flight
item.description: In this episode streamed on Dec. 19, 2019, we talk about air taxis and the future of flight.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live – Halloween Costume and Cosplay Contest
item.description: In this episode streamed on Oct. 24, 2019, we host our second annual NASA-themed Halloween costume and cosplay contest!

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live – Is There Life on Mars?
item.description: In this episode we talk about how we’re developing new tools to search for life on Mars.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Space Robots
item.description: In this episode streamed on August 29, 2019, we talk about how we design and build robots to work with humans in space.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - How to Get an Internship at NASA
item.description: In this episode we talk about how to get an internship at NASA.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Apollo 50th Anniversary Show
item.description: On July 20, 1969, humans took their first steps on the Moon. In this episode streamed on July 18, 2019, we talk about this historic achievement and our future plans to go to the Moon and on to Mars.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Moon 2024: Countdown to Arrival
item.description: In this episode streamed on June 19, 2019, we talk about our plans to land astronauts on the Moon by 2024 and how exploring the Moon will help us prepare to send humans to Mars.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Holiday Unboxing
item.description: In this episode streamed on Dec. 20, 2018, we get into the holiday spirit with a special holiday unboxing episode, where we showcase some of the amazing gifts NASA’s Ames Research Center has contributed to the agency’s mission of exploration and scientific discovery.

item.title: Jennifer Dungan Talks About Studying the Earth with Satellites
item.description: A conversation with Jennifer Dungan, a research scientist at NASA’s Ames Research Center and project manager for the big-data Earth science initiative, the NASA Earth Exchange.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Exploring Space with the World’s Largest Flying Telescope
item.description: In this episode streamed on Dec. 6, 2018, we talk about SOFIA, the world's largest flying telescope, and the history of airborne astronomy.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - The Science of Heat Shields
item.description: In this episode streamed on Nov. 15, 2018, we talk about the science of heat shields, how spacecraft survive the extreme temperatures experienced during atmospheric entry and more!

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - The Wonder Women of NASA
item.description: In this episode streamed on Nov. 8, 2018, we talk with some brilliant wonder women of NASA about their research, what it’s like to work at NASA’s Ames Research Center and more!

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Halloween Costume and Cosplay Contest
item.description: In this episode streamed on Oct. 25, 2018, we host our first-ever NASA-themed Halloween costume and cosplay contest!

item.title: Linda Jensen and Kerry Zarchi Talk About Leadership Training
item.description: A conversation with Linda Jensen, associate director for Workforce Culture and Engagement and Kerry Zarchi, the branch chief for Entry Systems and Vehicle Development and also the acting branch chief for Aerothermodynamics. Both are at NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Robotic Exploration of the Moon
item.description: In this episode streamed on Oct. 11, 2018, we talk about exploring the Moon with robots, NASA’s 60th anniversary and more!

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Let’s Play Space Video Games!
item.description: In this episode streamed on Sept. 27, 2018, we talk about space video games, exploring deep space and more.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Genius Space Hacks
item.description: In this episode streamed on Sept. 13, 2018, we talk about studying life in space. Plus, we share some genius space hacks for doing life science research on Earth and aboard the International Space Station.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Searching for Life Beyond Earth
item.description: In this episode streamed on Aug. 30, 2018, we talk with NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine and hear from scientists advancing the search for life beyond Earth by exploring an alien world deep in Earth’s ocean.

item.title: Eugene Tu and Carol Carroll Talk About NASA Ames Research Center
item.description: A conversation with the leadership of NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley, Center Director Eugene Tu and Deputy Center Director Carol Carroll.

item.title: Ruth Globus and Jon Galazka Talk About Biology Data from Space
item.description: A conversation with Jon Galazka, project scientist for NASA’s GeneLab, and Ruth Globus, a rodent research project scientist, at NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: James De Buizer Talks About SOFIA’s New Zealand Observations
item.description: A conversation with James De Buizer, the science planning and instrument support manager for the Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy or SOFIA.

item.title: Komal Sadhwani Talks About Law on Earth for the Benefit of Space
item.description: A conversation with Komal Sadhwani, an attorney at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Donovan Mathias and Eric Stern Talk About Asteroid Threats
item.description: A conversation with Donovan Mathias and Eric Stern. Eric is a research scientist here at Ames who supports the agency’s Planetary Defense initiative, and Donovan is an aerospace engineer in the NASA Advanced Supercomputing Division.

item.title: Lynn Harper and Monsi Roman Talk About The Vascular Tissue Challenge
item.description: Lynn Harper and Monsi Roman Talk About The Vascular Tissue Challenge

item.title: Alan Rhodes and Harvey Moseley Talk About Creating SOFIA’s Instruments
item.description: A conversation with Alan Rhodes, instrument development manager for the Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley, and Harvey Moseley a senior astrophysicist at NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland.

item.title: Parimal Kopardekar Talks About Managing Drones in our Skies
item.description: A rerun of a conversation with Parimal Kopardekar, NASA’s senior technologist for the Air Transportation System at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Lika Guhathakurta and Ryan McGranaghan Talk About Space Weather
item.description: A conversation with Lika Guhathakurta, lead program scientist for new initiatives in the Exploration Technology Directorate at NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley, and Ryan McGranaghan, postdoctoral researcher from NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California.

item.title: Jon Jenkins Talks About Kepler and TESS Data, from Pixels to Planets
item.description: A conversation with Jon Jenkins, the science lead for the Science Processing Operations Center at NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley. At the SPOC, the raw data from NASA’s newly launched planet hunter, TESS, is prepared for scientists to analyze.

item.title: Karen Bradford Talks About Connecting People
item.description: A conversation with Karen Bradford, chief of staff for the center director at NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Robin Aube-Warren Talks About the DART Team and Center Operations
item.description: A conversation with Robin Aube-Warren, the director of center operations at NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Robin Beck Talks About Designing Heat Shields to Protect Spacecraft
item.description: A conversation with Robin Beck, an engineer at NASA’s Ames Research Center in California’s Silicon Valley who develops, designs and tests heat shield materials.

item.title: NASA and the USGS, a Shared History in Remote Sensing
item.description: A conversation with Jim Brass, Bruce Coffland from NASA and Susan Benjamin USGS director of the Western Geographic Science Center. They discuss the shared history between NASA and the USGS in remote sensing.

item.title: Doug Caldwell Talks About the Data Pipeline for the TESS Mission
item.description: A conversation with Doug Caldwell, instrument scientist for the Kepler Space Telescope, and who’s now working on NASA’s next planet-hunting mission— the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite or TESS.

item.title: Kimberly Ennico Smith Talks About Pluto and Studying Space With SOFIA
item.description: A rerun of a conversation with Kimberly Ennico Smith, project scientist for SOFIA, the Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy, at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Sharmila Bhattacharya on Studying How Biology Changes in Space
item.description: A conversation with Sharmila Bhattacharya, senior scientist in the Space Biosciences Research branch at NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Jessie Dotson and Geert Barentsen, Kepler’s Contributions to Astronomy
item.description: A conversation with Jessie Dotson, Kepler’s project scientist, and Geert Barentsen, director of the mission's guest observer office, talking about how NASA’s first planet-hunting mission has contributed so much to the field of astronomy.

item.title: Charlie Sobeck Talks About Kepler’s Upcoming End of Flight
item.description: A conversation with Charlie Sobeck, Kepler’s former mission manager and now system engineer at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Marianne Sowa and Jack Miller Discuss Radiation Science Using GeneLab
item.description: A conversation with and Marianne Sowa, branch chief of the Space Biosciences Research branch at NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley, and Jack Miller, Lawrence Berkeley Laboratory, about radiation science using GeneLab.

item.title: Chris McKay and Ron Oremland Talk About Ocean Worlds and the Search for Life
item.description: A conversation with Chris McKay from NASA and Ronald Oremland from the U.S. Geological Survey about ocean worlds and the search for life. This is the third episode of a mini-series about NASA and USGS collaboration.

item.title: Chad Frost and Susan De La Cruz Talk About the “Social Networks” of Wildlife
item.description: A conversation with Chad Frost from NASA and Susan De La Cruz from the USGS. This is the second episode of a mini-series about NASA and USGS collaboration. In this episode they focus on tracking wildlife and what that information can tell us about the social networks between animals.

item.title: Ian Brosnan and Colin Williams Talk About the USGS Moving to NASA Ames
item.description: A conversation with Ian Brosnan from NASA and Colin Williams from the USGS. This is the first episode of a mini-series about NASA and USGS collaboration. To hear more from Ian Brosnan, listen to his previous NASA in Silicon Valley episode, Ian Brosnan Talks About How NASA Collaborates and Shares Data with Other Agencies.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Meet NASA in Silicon Valley
item.description: In this episode streamed on Feb. 12, 2018, we talk about the exciting research happening at NASA's Ames Research Center with Center Director Eugene Tu and participants of the 2018 #StateOfNASA NASA Social event at Ames.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Ep. 03 - Let’s Play Space Video Games!
item.description: In our third episode, we’re playing space-based games with NASA gamers! We talk about how true to life space-based games are with NASA researchers/gamers Chad Frost, Thomas Lambot and Mary Beth Wilhelm.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Episode 02 - Self-driving Robots, Planes and Automobiles
item.description: We’ve launched a live video show on Twitch called NASA in Silicon Valley Live! This is an audio-only version of our premiere episode that streamed on Jan. 12. In it, we talk about going back to the Moon with NASA rock stars Jim Green and Greg Schmidt.

item.title: Jose Benavides Talks About NASA's Star Wars-inspired Robots Aboard The International Space Station
item.description: A conversation with Jose Benavides, engineer with the Advanced Control and Evolvable Systems Group in the Intelligent Systems Division at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Terry Fong Talks About Virtual Reality, Self-Driving Cars and the Future of Robotics
item.description: For episode 76, we're re-posting episode 24, a conversation with Terry Fong, senior scientist for autonomous systems and lead for the Intelligent Robotics Group at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: NASA in Silicon Valley Live - Episode 01 - We're Going Back to the Moon!
item.description: We’ve launched a live video show on Twitch called NASA in Silicon Valley Live! This is an audio-only version of our premiere episode that streamed on Jan. 12. In it, we talk about going back to the Moon with NASA rock stars Jim Green and Greg Schmidt.

item.title: Coming Soon to Twitch: NASA in Silicon Valley Live
item.description: We’re launching a new live show on Twitch called NASA in Silicon Valley Live!

item.title: Throwback Thursday Featuring Veteran Astronaut Steve Smith
item.description: The rebroadcast of a conversation with veteran astronaut Steven Smith, former Associate Director for International Space Station Science Directorate at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: 2017 End of Year Podcast
item.description: An end of year compilation of conversations with various NASA scientists, engineers, and researchers throughout 2017 on the NASA in Silicon Valley Podcast.

item.title: Steven Zornetzer Talks About Building the Greenest Building in Government
item.description: A conversation with Steven Zornetzer, the associate center director at NASA’s Ames Research Center in California’s Silicon Valley, discussing Sustainability Base.

item.title: Kimberly Ennico Smith and Michael Person Talk About Steering SOFIA Through Triton’s Shadow
item.description: A conversation with Kimberly Ennico Smith, the project scientist for the SOFIA mission at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley, and Michael Person, a research scientist at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, discussing the science behind using an occultation to learn more about objects in space, such as Neptune’s moon Triton.

item.title: John Hogan Talks About Life Support in Space
item.description: A conversation with John Hogan, an environmental scientist at the bioengineering branch at NASA’s Ames Research Center.

item.title: Sylvain Costes Talks About NASA’s Treasure Trove of Space Biology Data
item.description: A conversation with Sylvain Costes, the Project Manager for GeneLab, a space biology database run out of NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Dennis Leveson-Gower and Shane Kimbrough Talk About the Science and Cargo NASA Sends to Space
item.description: A conversation with project scientist Dennis Leveson-Gower and astronaut Shane Kimbrough on the cargo sent up to the International Space Station, and the science it contains.

item.title: Kevin Sato Talks About Preparing Humans for Mars
item.description: A conversation with Kevin Sato, the Project Scientist and Deputy Project Manager of NASA’s Space Biology research projects.

item.title: Roger Hunter Talks About Taking Big Risks with Small Satellites
item.description: A conversation with Roger Hunter, Program Manager for the Spacecraft Technology Program at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Stevan Spremo Talks About Boxing Up Bacteria for Space Travel
item.description: A conversation with Stevan Spremo, Space Flight Project Manager at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Bron Nelson and Dimitris Menemenlis Talk About Modeling Oceans and Ice With Supercomputers
item.description: A conversation with Bron Nelson, a computer programmer with the Data Analysis and Visualization Group at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley, and Dimitris Menemenlis, a research scientist working with the Estimation of the Circulation and Climate of the Ocean (ECCO) project at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory.

item.title: Adam Moreno Talks About Supercomputing for Global Systems
item.description: A conversation with Adam Moreno, a postdoctoral fellow working with the NASA Earth Exchange at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Chris Potter Talks about Wildfires and a Changing Climate
item.description: A conversation with Chris Potter, a Senior Research Scientist at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Astronomy from 40,000 Feet and 43.5 Degrees South: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on August 31, 2017.

item.title: Ved Chirayath Talks About Imaging Through the Ocean Surface
item.description: A conversation with Ved Chirayath, research scientist and lead for the Laboratory for Advanced Sensing at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Solving the Mystery of Pluto’s Giant Blades of Ice: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on September 26, 2017.

item.title: Leighton Quon Talks About New Air Traffic System Demonstrations
item.description: A conversation with Leighton Quon, project manager in the Airspace Technology Division at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Jessica Marquez Talks About Planning and Managing Daily Tasks for Astronauts
item.description: A conversation with Jessica Marquez, human systems engineer and research scientist at NASA’s Ames Research Center.

item.title: Air Traffic “Win-Win” Wins NASA Software of the Year: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on September 1, 2017.

item.title: Three Cassini Scientists Give a Fond Farewell to the Mission
item.description: A conversation with three members of the original Cassini science team: Jeff Cuzzi, the mission’s interdisciplinary scientist for rings; Dale Cruikshank, an astronomer and planetary scientist studying Saturn’s icy moons; and Chris McKay, a planetary scientist and one of the original collaborators on the Huygens probe.

item.title: Rodents Help NASA Take the Next Step to Mars: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on August 14, 2017.

item.title: Jeff Cuzzi Talks About Saturn and the Many Things Cassini Taught Us
item.description: A conversation with Jeff Cuzzi, interdisciplinary scientist for rings on the Cassini mission and researcher in the Planetary Systems Branch at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Doing Science with Transits and Occultations: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on August 17, 2017.

item.title: Chris McKay Talks About Life in Extreme Places
item.description: A conversation with Chris McKay, senior scientist at the Planetary Systems Branch of NASA's Ames Research Center who works on projects from Cassini to Curiosity.

item.title: Jerry Davis Talks About Cybersecurity and Information Sharing at NASA
item.description: A conversation with Jerry Davis, the Chief Information Officer at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Lika Guhathakurta Talks About Studying the Sun and the 2017 Total Solar Eclipse
item.description: A conversation with Madhulika Guhathakurta, lead program scientist for new initiatives in the Exploration Technology Directorate at NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley, and the lead scientist for the 2017 total solar eclipse.

item.title: Eclipse Balloons: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on July 27, 2017.

item.title: Charlie Sobeck talks about Kepler, Troubleshooting, Transits and Eclipses
item.description: A conversation with Charlie Sobeck, Kepler mission manager at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Hanwant Singh Talks About Earth Science and His Selection as a Finalist for the 2017 Sammies Awards
item.description: A conversation with Hanwant Singh, atmospheric research director at NASA's Ames Research Center, and finalist for the 2017 Samuel J. Heyman Service to America awards.

item.title: The Dark Side of the Crater: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on July 26, 2017.

item.title: Uland Wong Talks About Robots on the Moon
item.description: A conversation with Uland Wong, senior computer scientist in the Intelligent Robotics Group at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Brian Day Talks About Tracking Fireballs
item.description: A conversation with Brian Day, the Director of Communication and Citizen Science for NASA’s Solar System Exploration Research Virtual Institute.

item.title: Jack Boyd Talks About His 70 Years with NASA (and NACA)
item.description: A conversation with Jack Boyd, Senior Advisor to the Center Director at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: William Reach Talks About NASA’s Flying Telescope in New Zealand
item.description: A conversation with William Reach, Deputy Director at the SOFIA Science Center at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Bill Thigpen Talks About How NASA Uses Supercomputers
item.description: A conversation with Bill Thigpen, Branch Chief of Advanced Computing at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Geert Barentsen Talks About Bringing People Together To Contribute to Exoplanet Science
item.description: A conversation with Geert Barentsen, the Guest Observer Office director for the Kepler and K2 mission at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Podcast Archive 2009: NASA’s Kepler Mission to Look for Earth-like Planets
item.description: Originally aired on February 27, 2009, a conversation on the Kepler Mission with Principal Investigator William Borucki, Deputy Principal Investigator David Koch, and Kepler Science Council Member Alan Boss from the Carnegie Institute of Washington.

item.title: Susan Thompson Talks About Creating Kepler Planet Catalogs
item.description: A conversation with Susan Thompson, Kepler research scientist for the SETI Institute at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: SOFIA Finds Cool Dust Around Energetic Active Black Holes: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on June 13, 2017.

item.title: Natalie Batalha Talks About Hunting Exoplanets with the Kepler Space Telescope
item.description: A conversation with one of TIME Magazine’s 100 Most Influential People, Natalie Batalha, the Kepler mission project scientist at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Understanding Star Formation in the Nucleus of Galaxy IC 342: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on May 23, 2017.

item.title: Bruce Yost Talks About Small Satellite Collaboration with NASA
item.description: A conversation with Bruce Yost, the Director of the Small Spacecraft Systems Virtual Institute (or S3VI) at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Leticha Hawkins Talks About How to Get a Job At NASA
item.description: A conversation with Leticha Hawkins, a recruiter at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Parimal Kopardekar Talks About Managing Drones in our Skies
item.description: A conversation with Parimal Kopardekar, NASA’s senior technologist for the Air Transportation System at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Jessie Dotson Talks About Discovering Exoplanets
item.description: A conversation with Jessie Dotson, project scientist for the Kepler spacecraft’s K2 mission at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Jonathan Galazka Talks About Designing Experiments for the International Space Station
item.description: A conversation with Johnathan Galazka, a scientist in the Space Biosciences Research Branch at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: SOFIA Confirms Nearby Planetary System is Similar to Our Own: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on May 2, 2017.

item.title: Marc Murbach Talks About Building Small Cube Satellites
item.description: A conversation with Marc Murbach, the Principal Investigator for the Technology Education Satellite (TechEdSat) based at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Formation Time of Mega Basins on Mars: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA's Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on April 26, 2017.

item.title: Jose Benavides Talks About NASA's Star Wars-inspired Robots Aboard The International Space Station
item.description: A conversation with Jose Benavides, engineer with the Advanced Control and Evolvable Systems Group in the Intelligent Systems Division at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Steve Ord Talks About Launching New Technologies Into Space
item.description: A conversation with Steve Ord, Technology Manager within the Flight Opportunities Program at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Experiment Reveals Earth Microbes’ Likely Fate on Mars: Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on March 30, 2017.

item.title: Brian Glass Talks About Searching For Evidence of Life On Mars
item.description: A conversation with Brian Glass, Principal Investigator of the Atacama Rover Astrobiology Drilling Studies (ARADS) project at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Jerry Colen Talks About Creating the NASA App
item.description: A conversation with Jerry Colen, NASA IT Manager for the Office of Public Affairs at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Kimberly Ennico Smith Talks About Pluto and Studying Space With A Flying Telescope
item.description: A conversation with Kimberly Ennico Smith, Project Scientist for SOFIA at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Brian Gore Talks About Exploring The Limits of Human Performance
item.description: A conversation with Brian Gore, Human Systems Integration Division at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Yvonne Pendleton Talks About Building A Dream Team For Exploring The Solar System
item.description: A conversation with Dr. Yvonne Pendleton, the Director of the Solar System Exploration Research Virtual Institute (SSERVI).

item.title: Ali Guarneros Luna Talks About Engineering a New Path to Space
item.description: A conversation with Ali Guarneros Luna, NASA Engineer and Deputy Project Manager at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.description: A conversation about NASA’s Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA) and the Echelon-Cross-Echelle Spectrograph (EXES) science instrument with Matthew Richter, Principle Investigator, and Edward Montiel, Postdoctoral Scholar.

item.title: Elizabeth Pane Talks About Sending Science Experiments To The International Space Station
item.description: A conversation with Elizabeth Pane, ISS Payload Manager in the Flight Systems and Implementation Branch at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: Unique Tiltrotor Test Rig: NASA in Silicon Valley Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on January 13, 2017.

item.description: A conversation with Ian Brosnan, Special Assistant for New National Aeronautics and Space Administration and United States Geological Survey Science Initiatives.

item.description: A feature from NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on January 19, 2017.

item.description: A conversation with Jeremy Frank, Principle Investigator for the Autonomous Systems and Operations Project at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.description: A feature from NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on January 5, 2017.

item.description: A conversation with Nettie Roozeboom, aerospace engineer in the Wind Tunnel Division at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.description: A conversation with Terry Fong, Senior Scientist for Autonomous Systems and Lead for the Intelligent Robotics Group at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.description: An end of year compilation of conversations with various NASA scientists, engineers, and researchers throughout 2016 on the NASA in Silicon Valley Podcast.

item.description: A conversation with Lynn Rothschild, astrobiologist and synthetic biologist in the Earth Science Division at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.description: A feature from NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on December 8, 2016.

item.description: A conversation with Michelle Eshow, Software Lead for Air Traffic Management at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.description: A conversation with Kai Goebel, Tech Area Lead for Discovery and Systems Health at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.description: A conversation with John Marmie, Asteroid Redirect Mission Commercial Partnerships & Hosted Payload Lead.

item.description: A conversation with Daniel Andrews, Project Manager for NASA’s Resource Prospector mission.

item.description: A conversation with U.S. Navy Lieutenant Commander Leedjia Svec, Director of Military Programs at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.description: A feature from NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on October 14, 2016.

item.description: A feature from NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on October 19, 2016.

item.description: A conversation with Stuart Rogers, a NASA Aerospace Engineer in the Advanced Supercomputing Division at NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley.

item.title: NASA Establishes the Small Spacecraft Systems Virtual Institute: NASA in Silicon Valley Podcast
item.description: A feature from NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley originally posted on October 21, 2016.

item.title: James Cockrell, Small Spacecrafts: NASA in Silicon Valley Podcast
item.description: A conversation with James Cockrell, Project Manager for Small Spacecrafts.

item.title: Pamela Marcum, SOFIA: NASA in Silicon Valley Podcast
item.description: A conversation with Pamela Marcum, Project Scientist on the Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy project, also known as SOFIA.

item.title: SOFIA Detects Collapsing Clouds Becoming Young Suns: NASA in Silicon Valley Podcast
